member.name: P:Ifs.Fnd.Windows.Forms.InfoViz.TreeMap.FndTreeMap.ParentValue
member.summary: A KeyField value to use as the Root node when constructing the treemap. If left empty, the KeyField value with a null ParentField value will be chosen as the root node. The ParentField can have only a single null value where the corresponding KeyField value would serve as the default root of the treemap.

member.name: P:Ifs.Fnd.Windows.Forms.InfoViz.TreeMap.FndTreeMap.ParentField
member.summary: Data column name. This, along with the Key Field will implement the parent-child relationship in the treemap. Each value here will correspond to a treemap node having child nodes(i.e. an aggregate node).

member.name: P:Ifs.Fnd.Windows.Forms.InfoViz.TreeMap.FndTreeMap.KeyField
member.summary: Data field whose values are used to construct the treemap. Each value here corresponds to a treemap node. Must be a field with unique values(e.g. primary key field).

member.name: P:Ifs.Fnd.Windows.Forms.InfoViz.TreeMap.FndTreeMap.Delimiter
member.summary: Delimiter used to separate field values in the DelimiterSource string. This string can be used to build the treemap. A valid delimiter is any one of values specified in enumeration.

member.name: P:Ifs.Fnd.Windows.Forms.InfoViz.TreeMap.FndTreeMap.ColorField
member.summary: Numeric or string type data column name. Based on its value, the corresponding treemap node will be assigned a colour.For a string field, distinct colours will be assigned to corresponding nodes and nodes having the same colour field value, will have the same colour. For a numeric field, each node will have a blend of 2 colours representing its colour field value. Two colours that blend represent the max. and min. colour field values.
